item.description:
Please RSVP!

Investment Opportunities in Turbulent Times

Presentation by Jim Lowell, chief Investment Strategist, Adviser Investments; Editor, Fidelity Investor, Fidelity Sector Investor, the ETF Advisor, and the ETF Trader

Jim Lowell will give his outlook on current economic trends and market dynamics.   Stock markets face headwinds including the Japanese earthquake, unrest in the Middle East, and the European debt crises.  In the U.S., we face growing national debt, our housing is recovering slowly, and high unemployment persists.   Nonetheless, the U.S. economy is improving, and corporate earnings are growing.

Jim will present his recommended mutual funds and ETFs and discuss why he thinks they have the most potential for price appreciation.    Also, he’ll mention some which he thinks investors should avoid. 

Jim Lowell edits the award-winning independent newsletter, Fidelity Investor.  Also, is an investment columnist for Forbes Magazine, and the editor-in-chief of The Forbes ETF Advisor.   Lowell has written several books on investing, most recently Investing from Scratch (Penguin, 2007) and What Every Fidelity Investor Needs to Know (Wiley, 2007).  In Addition, he frequently appears on CNBC and Bloomberg, and he’s often quoted in publications such as Barrons, Business Week, Fortune, and The Wall Street Journal. 

Mr. Lowell graduated from Vassar College and holds master's degrees from Harvard University and Trinity College in Dublin.

We look forward to hearing Jim’s market outlook, and his ETF and mutual fund picks.  He will have a lengthy Q & A session.

 

To join our online discussion go to
http://groups.google.com/group/bostonibd

 

If you have a friend you talk stocks with, bring them with you!

We strongly urge each person to make his or her own decisions about investing their money. Investment ideas and recommendations made during our meetings and in our online dialogs bear no liability by anyone.

This is a free and open meeting. No membership is required, but please RSVP.
item.name: Special Speakers Meeting - Jim Lowell, Editor, Fidelity Investor
